section.title: Can I mount the portage tree ( /usr/portage ) via NFS?

body.p: Mounting /usr/portage over NFS is possible. However you must be careful to run emerge --metadata on all clients who are mounting the tree over NFS. Otherwise their Portage cache's will be stable and Portage will run rather slowly. You need not run emerge --sync on every client. If you encounter problems with an NFS setup it is important that you ensure you have the proper locking daemons on both the NFS client machines and the NFS server machine. Portage uses hardlinks over NFS in an attempt to lock files; if the locking daemon fails to lock files Portage may complain about failed or stale locks. There is a script /usr/lib/portage/bin/clean_locks that can be used to clean out old lockfiles.
